title: Calories in a Vietnamese Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in a Vietnamese sandwich (banh mi), including full nutrition breakdown, protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard pork banh mi: 6-inch baguette, pate, grilled pork, pickled carrots/daikon, cucumber, cilantro, chili; no extra mayo.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, ingredients, and vendor; values are averages. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A typical Vietnamese sandwich (banh mi) has about 600 kcal, with ~25 g protein and ~70 g carbs from the baguette.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian tofu version (replace pork with tofu)

faqs.q: How many calories in a Vietnamese sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 600 kcal for a standard pork banh mi.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a banh mi?
faqs.a: About 25 g, mainly from the pork or protein filling.

faqs.q: Are Vietnamese sandwiches high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically ~1500 mg due to pate, soy sauce, and pickled veggies.

faqs.q: How do carbs break down in a Vietnamese sandwich?
faqs.a: Mostly from the baguette: ~70 g total carbs, 4 g fiber.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie Vietnamese sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for whole-grain bread or leaner proteins like chicken to reduce by 50-100 kcal.
